instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3462: What is 820-3462? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PM_BATLOW_L: What is PM_BATLOW_L? PM_BATLOW_L is a signal that tells the system the battery is too low for it to turn on & keeps it from turning on, when it is low. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.SMC_ADAPTER_EN: What is SMC_ADAPTER_EN? SMC_ADAPTER_EN enables the machine to work off of the power adapter when the proper power adapter is attached. Attacching an 85w Macbook Pro 15” power adapter to a 13” Macbook that requires a 60w power adapter is ok, attaching a 45w Macbook Air power adapter to a 15” macbook Pro that needs an 85w power adapter will result in SMC_ADAPTER_EN missing. .
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK: What is SMC_BC_ACOK? This is identical to CHGR_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.R6905: What is R6905? Resistor between charger voltage and input to PP3V42_G3H power supply on older Macbooks, pre-2011 models. This resistor blows when C6990 has shorted to ground or U6990 has shorted to ground, and will result in PP3V42_G3H missing and the magsafe charger not having a light since PP3V42_G3H is necessary for the SMC to turn on and the onewire circuit to turn on..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage
threads.message: i have a mac that tries to turn on, that just sits and spins the "right" fan, the "left fan never kicks on, with that being said. how do you test this board? since it wont power up without the battery plugged in, and you have to screw in the battery how do you test voltages on the side of the board facing down? also i don't seam to have a board view file just schematics, any advice on this one would really help

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage
threads.message:
The board doesn't start without battery, why would you want to check voltages with battery connected???
You must make it works with charger only...
First be sure to use correct charger.
Check <SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>SMC_ADAPTER_EN</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL>, green light on magsafe...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage
threads.message:
this board starts fine with no battery connected. It'll just run slow. 

is this doingg that thing where the fan spins for a quarter of a second then dies? If so, check clock area, check current sensing around <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage
threads.message:
I meant his board doesn't start without battery.
But there is n reason to try repair it with battery, as he needs to repair it on charger only...

He complained cannot measure because need to connect battery.
In fact he don't need to connect battery.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage
threads.message: ok knew this one had the special battery bridge, thought it needed to have a battery to turn on. with the screw in, and power comming from charger it turns right on, with screw undone it does nothing but greenlight. once i get a chance ill test voltages, with that said i did ask about brd view files for this board. i do have schematics. but im not well versed to know what part matches up to the schematic

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage
threads.message: omg nvm im just blind, i have the brd file...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage
threads.message:
Remove the board from case.
It should start by itself when you plug (original) 85w charger...
Then you can measure what you want on the desk.
Be aware <SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL> low means normally fake charger. But still could be something else.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage
threads.message: sorry been waiting on a few parts, <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 12.6 on <RESISTOR>R6905</RESISTOR> , the one fan died, so that takes care of the no fan spinning up, i do have green light. but it just starts up and never chimes. smc is safe to assume is ok, right?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage
threads.message: Fan spins? Do you get a light on the USB mouse?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage
threads.message: and figured out why it wouldnt turn on without battery, bc someone switched my charger with the 45w i used the 60w and its powering like it should. just wont boot
